page.title: 01Bottisham Fen general review
page.content: Bottisham Fen area lies just to the south of the river Cam, and includes part of Swaffham Prior Fen. It is bisected by Swaffham Lode which runs from SE to NW to join the Cam at Swaffham Lock. A second lode, the Bottisham Lode, crosses the SW corner in parallel with the former. The NE corner stops a few metres short of the Reach Lode. All three are ancient navigation and drainage channels, carrying water across the low fenlands from the chalk hills to the south. The land is mainly arable, bounded by drainage ditches, minor roads and grass droveways (farm tracks). The soil is fertile and peaty in places, having been reclaimed from fen within the last hundred years or so. It is now very well drained and does not flood. Population is sparse.
